sentences.english: Higgins tried to mould the cockney girl into a elegant lady.

sentences.chinese: 黑夜獨哭的人是否都是外表恨堅強，心理卻很柔弱呢？

sentences.english: And even stumbling speech may strengthen a weak tongue.
sentences.chinese: 連那失錯的言語，有時也能激動柔弱的舌頭。

sentences.english: This was probably to make them look ridiculous or more effeminate .

sentences.english: He was of a delicate mind and body, and he died at an early age.

sentences.english: The stars hold their breath counting the hours， the feeble moon swims the deep night.
sentences.chinese: 星辰屏息地數着時間，柔弱的月兒在夜中浮泛。

sentences.english: At the beginning of the school year, Tomoya meets Nagisa Furukawa, a soft-spoken girl.
sentences.chinese: 在學年一開始，朋也遇到了渚，一個柔弱的女孩。

definition: too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
tender and soft as water/deeply attached to sb
